intro: Conopodium richteri, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Conopodium richteri is often found in alpine meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance.
